translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs
The Chapter with Sumedhā
The Elder Nun Naḷamālikā’s Verses
On the bank of the Candabhāgā River,
I was a kinnarī then.
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
the self-dependent, the unconquered.
With a mind full of confidence, joyful,
with awareness, with hands placed palm-to-palm,
I took a garland of reeds
and worshipped the self-dependent one.
Because of that good deed,
and because of my intention and aspiration,
I abandoned the kinnarī body
and went to the company of the gods.

analyzed: chattisa devarājūna  mahesittam akārayi  dasannam  mahesittam akārayi
translated: I was the chief queen of thirty-six gods,🔽and of ten Wheel-turning Monarchs.
I was inspired and my mind was stirred,
and I went forth into homelessness.
My defilements are ended,
all my existences are destroyed.
All my attachments are destroyed,
there is no return to any state of existence.
For ninety-four eons
I worshipped with a flower.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping with a flower.
My defilements are ended,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me🔽…
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.
The four analytical knowledges,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ naḷamālikā therī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam naḷamālikā therī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽This is what Venerable Naḷamālikā said,🔽and that is how she composed these verses.
The Story of Naḷamālikā, the Fifth of the Long Collection of Stories about the Elder Nuns is finished.
